title.zh: 卷二 顯宗孝明帝紀
title.en: Volume 2: Annals of Emperor Xianzong Xiaoming
title.raw: 卷二 顯宗孝明帝紀 Volume 2: Annals of Emperor Xianzong Xiaoming

sentences.zh: 顯宗孝明皇帝諱莊，光武第四子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaoming of the Xianzong, personal name Zhuang, was the fourth son of Emperor Guangwu.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaoming of the Xianzong, whose personal name was Zhuang, was Emperor Guangwu's fourth son.

sentences.zh: 母陰皇后。

translations.literal: His mother was Empress Yin.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was Empress Yin.

sentences.zh: 帝生而豐下，十歲能通《春秋》，光武奇之。

translations.literal: The Emperor was born with a prominent forehead; at age ten he mastered the Spring and Autumn Annals, and Emperor Guangwu was amazed by him.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor was born with a prominent forehead; by age ten he had mastered the Spring and Autumn Annals, which amazed Emperor Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 建武十五年封東海公，十七年進爵為王，十九年立為皇太子。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year of Jianwu, he was enfeoffed as Duke of Donghai; in the seventeenth year his title was advanced to King; in the nineteenth year he was established as Crown Prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year of Jianwu, he was enfeoffed as Duke of Donghai; in the seventeenth year his title was advanced to King; in the nineteenth year he was established as Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 師事博士桓榮，學通《尚書》。

translations.literal: He studied under the erudite Huan Rong and mastered the Book of Documents.
translations.idiomatic: He studied under the erudite scholar Huan Rong and thoroughly mastered the Book of Documents.

sentences.zh: 中元二年二月戊戌，即皇帝位，年三十。

translations.literal: In the second year of Zhongyuan, second month, on Wuxu day, he ascended the imperial throne at age thirty.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of Zhongyuan, on the Wuxu day of the second month, he ascended the imperial throne at age thirty.

sentences.zh: 尊皇后曰皇太后。

translations.literal: He honored the Empress as Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: He honored the Empress as Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 三月丁卯，葬光武皇帝於原陵。

translations.literal: In the third month, on Dingmao day, Emperor Guangwu was buried at Yuanling.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, on the Dingmao day, Emperor Guangwu was buried at Yuanling.

sentences.zh: 有司奏上尊廟曰世祖。

translations.literal: The officials submitted a memorial proposing to honor the temple as Shizu.
translations.idiomatic: The officials submitted a memorial proposing to honor his temple as Shizu.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙辰，詔曰：『予未小子，奉承聖業，夙夜震畏，不敢荒寧。

translations.literal: In summer, fourth month, on Bingchen day, he issued an edict: 'I, the young and unworthy one, inherit the sacred enterprise, trembling with fear morning and night, not daring to be indolent.'
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, on the Bingchen day, he issued an edict: 'I, the young and unworthy one, inherit the sacred enterprise, trembling with fear morning and night, not daring to be indolent.'

sentences.zh: 先帝受命中興，德侔帝王，協和萬邦，假於上下，懷柔百神，惠於鰥、寡。

translations.literal: The late Emperor received the mandate to restore order, his virtue equaling the ancient kings, harmonizing the myriad states, blessing high and low, pacifying the hundred spirits, showing benevolence to the widowed and orphaned.
translations.idiomatic: The late Emperor received the mandate to restore order, his virtue equaling that of the ancient kings, harmonizing all the states, blessing high and low alike, pacifying the hundred spirits, and showing benevolence to the widowed and orphaned.

sentences.zh: 朕承大運，繼體守文，不知稼穡之艱難，懼有廢失。

translations.literal: I inherit the great mandate, continue the lineage and preserve the institutions, yet I do not know the hardships of farming, and fear that there may be negligence.
translations.idiomatic: I inherit the great mandate, continue the imperial lineage and preserve the institutions, yet I do not know the hardships of plowing and sowing, and fear there may be negligence.

sentences.zh: 聖恩遺戒，顧重天下，以元元為首。

translations.literal: The sacred benevolence and final instructions regard the world as important, taking the common people as paramount.
translations.idiomatic: The sacred benevolence and final instructions consider the world important, taking the common people as paramount.

sentences.zh: 公卿百僚，將何以輔朕不逮？

translations.literal: Dukes, ministers, and all officials, how will you assist My shortcomings?
translations.idiomatic: Dukes, ministers, and all officials, how will you assist where I fall short?

sentences.zh: 其賜天下男子爵，人二級；

translations.literal: Let all males throughout the realm be granted advancement in noble rank, each by two levels;
translations.idiomatic: Let all males throughout the realm be granted advancement in noble rank, each by two levels;

sentences.zh: 三老、孝悌、力田人三級；

translations.literal: Three Elders, filial and fraternal people, and diligent farmers each by three levels;
translations.idiomatic: Three Elders, filial and fraternal people, and diligent farmers shall each be advanced three levels;

sentences.zh: 爵過公乘，得移與子若同產、同產子；

translations.literal: Those whose rank exceeds Gongcheng may transfer it to their sons or younger brothers or younger brothers' sons;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose noble rank exceeds Gongcheng may transfer it to their sons or younger brothers or nephews;

sentences.zh: 及流人無名數欲自占者人一級；

translations.literal: And exiled people without registered numbers who wish to register themselves each by one level;
translations.idiomatic: And exiled people without registered numbers who wish to register themselves shall each be advanced one level;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃粟，人十斛。

translations.literal: The widowed, orphaned, solitary, and severely disabled shall each receive ten dou of grain.
translations.idiomatic: The widowed, orphaned, solitary, and severely disabled shall each receive ten dou of grain.

sentences.zh: 其弛刑及郡國徒，在中元元年四月己卯赦前所犯而後捕繫者，悉免其刑。

translations.literal: Let those with suspended sentences and commandery prisoners who committed crimes before the amnesty of Jimao day in the fourth month of the first year of Zhongyuan but were captured and imprisoned afterward, all have their punishments remitted.
translations.idiomatic: Those with suspended sentences and commandery prisoners who committed crimes before the Jimao amnesty in the fourth month of Zhongyuan's first year but were captured and imprisoned afterward shall all have their punishments remitted.

sentences.zh: 又邊人遭亂為內郡人妻，在己卯赦前，一切遣還邊，恣其所樂。

translations.literal: Furthermore, border people who suffered disorder and became wives of inner commandery men before the Jimao amnesty shall all be sent back to the border, allowing them to follow their wishes.
translations.idiomatic: Furthermore, border people who became wives of inner commandery men during the disorders before the Jimao amnesty shall all be sent back to the border, allowing them to follow their own wishes.

sentences.zh: 中二千石下至黃綬，貶秩贖論者，悉皆復秩還贖。

translations.literal: For officials from the Two Thousand Bushel rank down to those with yellow sashes who were demoted or fined, all shall have their ranks restored and fines returned.
translations.idiomatic: All officials from the Two Thousand Bushel rank down to those with yellow sashes who were demoted or fined shall have their ranks restored and their fines returned.

sentences.zh: 方今上無天子，下無方伯，若涉淵水而無舟楫。

translations.literal: Now above there is no Son of Heaven, below there are no regional lords—it is like crossing deep waters without boats or oars.
translations.idiomatic: Now above there is no Son of Heaven, below there are no regional lords—it is like crossing deep waters without boats or oars.

sentences.zh: 夫萬乘至重而壯者慮輕，實賴有德左右小子。

translations.literal: The weight of the myriad chariots is great while the young one's considerations are light; I truly rely on virtuous ones to guide this young one.
translations.idiomatic: The burden of ruling the myriad chariots is heavy while a young man's judgment is light; I truly rely on virtuous men to guide this young one.

sentences.zh: 高密侯禹，元功之首；

translations.literal: Gaomi Marquis Yu is the foremost of the original meritorious officials;
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Yu of Gaomi is the foremost among the original meritorious officials;

sentences.zh: 東平王蒼，寬博有謀；

translations.literal: Dongping King Cang is broad-minded and strategic;
translations.idiomatic: King Cang of Dongping is broad-minded and strategic;

sentences.zh: 並可以受六尺之托，臨大節而不撓。

translations.literal: Both can receive the six-foot trust, and in the face of great trials will not bend.
translations.idiomatic: Both can receive the six-foot trust and, when facing great trials, will not bend.

sentences.zh: 其以禹為太傅，蒼為驃騎將軍。

translations.literal: Let Yu be made Grand Tutor, Cang be made General of Agile Cavalry.
translations.idiomatic: Let Yu be appointed Grand Tutor, Cang be appointed General of Agile Cavalry.

sentences.zh: 大尉憙告謚南郊，司徒訢奉安梓宮，司空魴將校復土。

translations.literal: Great Marshal Xi announced the posthumous name at the southern suburbs, Minister of the Masses Hong escorted the coffin, Minister of Works Pang led the officials in covering the soil.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Xi announced the posthumous name at the southern suburbs, Minister of the Masses Hong escorted the imperial coffin, Minister of Works Pang led the officials in covering the soil.

sentences.zh: 其封憙為節鄉侯，訢為安鄉侯，魴為楊邑侯。』

translations.literal: Let Xi be enfeoffed as Marquis of Jexiang, Hong as Marquis of Anxiang, Pang as Marquis of Yangyi.'
translations.idiomatic: Let Xi be enfeoffed as Marquis of Jexiang, Hong as Marquis of Anxiang, Pang as Marquis of Yangyi.'

sentences.zh: 秋九月，燒當羌寇隴西，敗郡兵於允街。

translations.literal: In autumn, ninth month, the Shaodang Qiang raided Longxi, defeating the commandery troops at Yunjie.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of autumn, the Shaodang Qiang raided Longxi and defeated the commandery troops at Yunjie.

sentences.zh: 赦隴西囚徒，減罪一等，勿收今年租調。

translations.literal: He granted amnesty to the prisoners of Longxi, reducing their sentences by one degree, and exempted them from this year's land tax and labor service.
translations.idiomatic: He amnestied the prisoners of Longxi, reduced their sentences by one degree, and exempted them from this year's land tax and corvée labor.

sentences.zh: 又所發天水三千人，亦復是歲更賦。

translations.literal: Furthermore, the three thousand men conscripted from Tianshui were also exempted from this year's taxes and duties.
translations.idiomatic: Furthermore, the three thousand men conscripted from Tianshui were also exempted from this year's poll tax and duties.

sentences.zh: 遣謁者張鴻討叛羌於允吾，鴻軍大敗，戰歿。

translations.literal: He dispatched Court Gentleman Zhang Hong to campaign against the rebel Qiang at Yunwu; Hong's army suffered a major defeat and he died in battle.
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched Court Gentleman Zhang Hong to campaign against the rebel Qiang at Yunwu; Hong's army suffered a major defeat and he was killed in battle.

sentences.zh: 冬十一月，遣中郎將竇固監捕虜將軍馬武等二將軍討燒當羌。

translations.literal: In winter, eleventh month, he dispatched Colonel of the Garrison Cavalry Dou Gu to supervise General of Capturing Barbarians Ma Wu and two other generals in campaigning against the Shaodang Qiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month of winter, he dispatched Colonel of the Garrison Cavalry Dou Gu to supervise General of Capturing Barbarians Ma Wu and two other generals in campaigning against the Shaodang Qiang.

sentences.zh: 十二月甲寅，詔曰：『方春戒節，人以耕桑。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Jia Yin day: He issued an edict saying: 'As spring approaches and the seasons change, people should focus on plowing and sericulture.'
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiayin day of the twelfth month, he issued an edict: 'As spring approaches and the seasons change, people should focus on plowing and sericulture.'

sentences.zh: 其勑有司務順時氣，使無煩擾。

translations.literal: Let him order the officials to diligently follow the seasonal changes so as not to cause disturbance.'
translations.idiomatic: Let him order the officials to diligently follow the seasonal changes so as not to cause disturbance.'

sentences.zh: 天下亡命殊死以下，聽得贖論：死罪入縑二十匹，右趾至髡鉗城旦舂十匹，完城旦舂至司寇作三匹。

translations.literal: Throughout the realm, those who have fled and committed crimes punishable by death or less may redeem their punishments: death penalty requires twenty bolts of silk, amputation of right foot to shaved head and iron collar with city wall building and pounding rice requires ten bolts, complete city wall building and pounding rice to working as prison guards requires three bolts.
translations.idiomatic: Throughout the realm, fugitives who committed crimes punishable by death or less may redeem their punishments: capital crimes require twenty bolts of silk, amputation of the right foot up to shaved head and iron collar with city wall building and rice pounding require ten bolts, complete city wall building and rice pounding up to prison guard duty require three bolts.

sentences.zh: 其未發覺，詔書到先自告者，半入贖。

translations.literal: Those whose crimes have not yet been discovered and who voluntarily confess after the edict arrives shall pay half the redemption amount.'
translations.idiomatic: Those whose crimes have not yet been discovered and who voluntarily confess after the edict arrives shall pay half the redemption amount.'

sentences.zh: 今選舉不實，邪佞未去，權門請托，殘吏放手，百姓愁怨，情無告訴。

translations.literal: Now selections are not genuine, sycophants have not been removed, powerful families make requests, corrupt officials run wild, the common people are distressed and resentful, with no way to make their grievances known.'
translations.idiomatic: Nowadays, official selections are not genuine, sycophants have not been removed, powerful families make requests, corrupt officials run wild, the common people are distressed and resentful, with no way to voice their grievances.'

sentences.zh: 有司明奏罪名，幷正舉者。

translations.literal: Officials should clearly memorialize the crimes and simultaneously correct the selections.'
translations.idiomatic: Officials should clearly memorialize the crimes and simultaneously correct the improper selections.'

sentences.zh: 又郡縣每因徵發，輕為奸利，詭責羸弱，先急下貧。

translations.literal: Furthermore, commanderies and counties often take advantage of conscription to engage in corrupt profiteering, falsely burdening the weak while pressing the poor first.'
translations.idiomatic: Furthermore, commanderies and counties often take advantage of conscription to engage in corrupt profiteering, falsely burdening the weak while demanding service from the poor first.'

sentences.zh: 其務在均平，無令枉刻。』

translations.literal: Let their efforts focus on fairness, not allowing wrongful harshness.'
translations.idiomatic: Let their efforts focus on fairness, not allowing wrongful harshness.'

sentences.zh: 永平元年春正月，帝率公卿已下朝於原陵，如元會儀。

translations.literal: Yongping first year, spring, first month: The Emperor led the dukes, ministers, and below in paying court at Yuanling, following the New Year's assembly ceremony.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of Yongping's first year, the Emperor led the dukes, ministers, and below in paying court at Yuanling, following the New Year's assembly ceremony.

sentences.zh: 夏五月，太傅鄧禹薨。

translations.literal: Summer, fifth month: Grand Tutor Deng Yu passed away.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month of summer, Grand Tutor Deng Yu passed away.

sentences.zh: 戊寅，東海王彊薨，遣司空馮魴持節視喪事，賜升龍旄頭、鑾輅，龍旂。

translations.literal: Wuyin day: Donghai King Qiang passed away; he dispatched Minister of Works Feng Pang holding the imperial tally to oversee the funeral arrangements and granted him a feathered canopy with ascending dragon, a luan carriage, and dragon banner.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuyin day, Donghai King Qiang passed away; he dispatched Minister of Works Feng Pang holding the imperial tally to oversee the funeral arrangements and granted him a feathered canopy with ascending dragon, a luan carriage, and dragon banner.

sentences.zh: 六月乙卯，葬東海恭王。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Yi Mao day: He buried King Gong of Donghai.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yimao day of the sixth month, he buried King Gong of Donghai.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，捕虜將軍馬武等與燒當羌戰，大破之。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: Commander-in-Chief of Capturing Barbarians Ma Wu and others fought the Shaodang Qiang, greatly defeating them.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, Commander-in-Chief of Capturing Barbarians Ma Wu and others fought against the Shaodang Qiang tribe, inflicting a major defeat upon them.

sentences.zh: 募士卒戍隴右，賜錢人三萬。

translations.literal: He recruited soldiers to garrison Longyou, granting each man thirty thousand cash.
translations.idiomatic: He recruited soldiers to garrison Longyou, granting thirty thousand cash to each man.

sentences.zh: 八月戊子，徙山陽王荊為廣陵王，遣就國。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Wuzi day: He transferred Shanyang King Jing to be Guangling King and sent him to his fief.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuzi day of the eighth month, he transferred King Jing of Shanyang to be King of Guangling and sent him to his fief.

sentences.zh: 是歲，遼東太守祭肜使鮮卑擊赤山烏桓，大破之，斬其渠帥。

translations.literal: This year: Liaodong Grand Administrator Ji Yong sent the Xianbei to attack the Chishan Wuhuan, greatly defeating them and beheading their chieftains.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Liaodong Grand Administrator Ji Yong sent the Xianbei to attack the Chishan Wuhuan tribe, inflicting a major defeat and beheading their chieftains.

sentences.zh: 越巂姑復夷叛，州郡討平之。

translations.literal: The Gufu Yi of Yuexi rebelled; the provincial and commandery officials pacified them.
translations.idiomatic: The Gufu Yi people of Yuexi rebelled, but the provincial and commandery officials pacified them.

sentences.zh: 二年春正月辛未，宗祀光武皇帝於明堂，帝及公卿列侯始服冠冕、衣裳、玉佩、絇屨以行事。

translations.literal: Second year, spring, first month, Xinwei day: Performed ancestral sacrifice to Emperor Guangwu in the Bright Hall; the emperor and the dukes, ministers, and marquises for the first time wore ceremonial caps, robes, jade pendants, and hemp sandals to conduct the ceremony.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinwei day of the first month of spring in the second year, ancestral rites were performed for Emperor Guangwu in the Bright Hall. For the first time, the emperor, dukes, ministers, and marquises wore ceremonial caps, robes, jade pendants, and hemp sandals to conduct the ceremony.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，登靈臺。

translations.literal: After the ceremony, ascended the Spirit Terrace.
translations.idiomatic: After the rites were completed, they ascended the Spirit Terrace.

sentences.zh: 使尚書令持節詔驃騎將軍、三公曰：『今令月吉日，宗祀光武皇帝於明堂，以配五帝。

translations.literal: Sent the Chamberlain for Attendants holding the imperial tally to decree the Cavalry General and Three Dukes: 'Today on this auspicious day of this month, we perform ancestral sacrifice to Emperor Guangwu in the Bright Hall, to be paired with the Five Emperors.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent the Chamberlain for Attendants holding the imperial tally to decree the Cavalry General and Three Dukes: 'Today on this auspicious day of the month, we perform ancestral rites for Emperor Guangwu in the Bright Hall, placing him alongside the Five Emperors.'

sentences.zh: 禮備法物，樂和八音，詠祉福，舞功德，班時令，勑群后。

translations.literal: The ceremonies are complete with ritual objects, the music harmonizes the eight tones, chanting blessings and fortune, dancing merit and virtue, distributing seasonal commands, instructing the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The rites are complete with proper ritual objects, the music harmonizes the eight tones, we chant blessings and good fortune, dance to display merit and virtue, distribute seasonal ordinances, and instruct the assembled feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 事畢，升靈臺，望元氣，吹時律，觀物變。

translations.literal: After the affairs are complete, ascend the Spirit Terrace, observe the primal qi, blow the seasonal pitch pipes, observe changes in things.
translations.idiomatic: After the ceremonies are finished, we ascend the Spirit Terrace to observe the primal qi, sound the seasonal pitch pipes, and watch for changes in the natural world.

sentences.zh: 群僚藩輔，宗室子孫，眾郡奉計，百蠻貢職，烏桓、濊貊咸來助祭，單于侍子、骨都侯亦皆陪位。

translations.literal: The assembled officials and vassals, imperial clan descendants, the various commanderies presenting accounts, the hundred barbarians offering tribute, the Wuhuan and Yemaek all came to assist in the sacrifice, the Chanyu’s attendant son and Guduhou also all took their positions.
translations.idiomatic: Assembled officials and vassal lords, imperial clan descendants, representatives from all commanderies presenting their accounts, the hundred barbarian tribes offering tribute, the Wuhuan and Yemaek all came to assist with the sacrifice, and even the Chanyu's attendant son and Guduhou took their proper positions.

sentences.zh: 斯固聖祖功德之所致也。

translations.literal: This is indeed brought about by the merit and virtue of our sagely ancestor.
translations.idiomatic: This flourishing is indeed brought about by the merit and virtue of our sagely ancestor.

sentences.zh: 朕以闇陋，奉承大業，親執珪璧，恭祀天地。

translations.literal: I, being dim and lowly, uphold the great enterprise, personally holding the jade tablets, reverently sacrificing to Heaven and Earth.
translations.idiomatic: Though I am unenlightened and base, I uphold this great enterprise, personally holding the jade tablets and reverently sacrificing to Heaven and Earth.

sentences.zh: 仰惟先帝受命中興，撥亂反正，以寧天下，封泰山，建明堂，立辟雍，起靈臺，恢弘大道，被之八極；

translations.literal: I look up and contemplate how the late emperor received the mandate to restore order, rectified chaos and returned to correctness to pacify the world, performed the Feng sacrifice at Mount Tai, built the Bright Hall, established the Biyong, erected the Spirit Terrace, broadened the great way, extending it to the eight extremes;
translations.idiomatic: I reverently contemplate how the late emperor received the mandate to restore order, rectified chaos and restored proper governance to pacify the world, performed the Feng sacrifice at Mount Tai, built the Bright Hall, established the Biyong Academy, erected the Spirit Terrace, broadened the great way, extending its influence to the eight corners of the world;

sentences.zh: 而胤子無成、康之質，群臣無呂、旦之謀，盥洗進爵，踧踖惟慙。

translations.literal: yet his descendants lack the quality of Cheng and Kang, his ministers lack the strategies of Lü and Dan, when washing and presenting the爵, I am filled with shame and trepidation.
translations.idiomatic: yet his descendants lack the character of Kings Cheng and Kang, his ministers lack the wisdom of Lü Wang and the Duke of Zhou, and when washing my hands and presenting the ceremonial cup, I am filled with shame and trepidation.

sentences.zh: 素性頑鄙，臨事益懼，故「君子坦蕩蕩，小人長戚戚」。

translations.literal: My inherent nature is stubborn and base, when facing affairs I become even more fearful, hence 'the gentleman is broad and expansive, the petty man is constantly anxious.'
translations.idiomatic: My innate nature is stubborn and vulgar, and when facing important matters I become even more fearful—hence the saying 'the gentleman is broad and expansive, the petty man is constantly anxious.'

sentences.zh: 其令天下自殊死已下，謀反大逆，皆赦除之。

translations.literal: Therefore, command that throughout the realm, from those sentenced to death by dismemberment and below, those who plotted rebellion and committed great treachery, all shall be pardoned and removed.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, command that throughout the empire, all cases from death by dismemberment downward—including those involving rebellion and great treachery—shall be pardoned and expunged.

sentences.zh: 百僚師尹，其勉脩厥職，順行時令，敬若昊天，以綏兆人。』

translations.literal: You hundred officials and teachers, earnestly cultivate your duties, follow and execute the seasonal commands, revere as if facing Vast Heaven, to pacify the myriad people.'
translations.idiomatic: You assembled officials and teachers, earnestly cultivate your respective duties, follow and implement the seasonal ordinances, revere them as you would face Vast Heaven, in order to pacify the multitude of people.'

sentences.zh: 三月，臨辟雍，初行大射禮。

translations.literal: Third month: He attended the Biyong and for the first time performed the great archery ceremony.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, he attended the Biyong Academy and for the first time performed the great archery ceremony.

sentences.zh: 秋九月，沛王輔、楚王英、濟南王康、淮陽王延、東海王政來朝。

translations.literal: Autumn, ninth month: King Fu of Pei, King Ying of Chu, King Kang of Jinan, King Yan of Huaiyang, King Zheng of Donghai came to court.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of autumn, Kings Fu of Pei, Ying of Chu, Kang of Jinan, Yan of Huaiyang, and Zheng of Donghai came to pay court to the emperor.

sentences.zh: 冬十月壬子，幸辟雍，初行養老禮。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Renzi day: He traveled to the Biyong and for the first time performed the ceremony for venerating the elderly.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renzi day of the tenth month of winter, he traveled to the Biyong Academy and for the first time performed the ceremony honoring the elderly.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『光武皇帝建三朝之禮，而未及臨饗。

translations.literal: He issued an edict saying: 'Emperor Guangwu established the rites of the three courts, but did not live to attend and enjoy them.'
translations.idiomatic: He issued an edict: 'Emperor Guangwu established the rites of the three courts, but did not live to personally attend and partake in them.'

sentences.zh: 眇眇小子，屬當聖業。

translations.literal: This insignificant boy has inherited the sagely enterprise.
translations.idiomatic: This insignificant son has inherited the sagely enterprise.

sentences.zh: 間暮春吉辰，初行大射；

translations.literal: Recently on an auspicious day in late spring, I first performed the great archery;
translations.idiomatic: Recently on an auspicious day in late spring, I first performed the great archery ceremony;

sentences.zh: 令月元日，復踐辟雍。

translations.literal: on the first day of this month, I again visited the Biyong.
translations.idiomatic: on the first day of this month, I again visited the Biyong Academy.

sentences.zh: 尊事三老，兄事五更，安車輭輪，供綏執授。

translations.literal: I honored the Three Elders as superiors, treated the Five Seniors as elder brothers, provided easy carriages with soft wheels, supplied reins and held them.
translations.idiomatic: I honored the Three Elders as superiors and treated the Five Seniors as elder brothers, providing them with comfortable carriages with soft wheels, supplying the reins and personally holding them.

sentences.zh: 侯王設醬，公卿饌珍，朕親袒割，執爵而酳。

translations.literal: The marquises and kings arrange the sauces, the dukes and ministers present the delicacies, I personally bare my arms and carve the meat, hold the goblet and offer the toast.
translations.idiomatic: The marquises and kings arrange the sauces, the dukes and ministers present the delicacies, I personally bare my arms and carve the meat, hold the goblet and offer the ceremonial drink.

sentences.zh: 祝哽在前，祝噎在後。

translations.literal: The blessing of abundance is in front, the blessing of prosperity is behind.
translations.idiomatic: The blessing of abundance is in front, the blessing of prosperity is behind.

sentences.zh: 升歌《鹿鳴》，下管《新宮》，八佾具修，萬舞於庭。

translations.literal: The ascending song was 'Deer Cry,' the descending pipes played 'New Palace,' the eight rows were all prepared, the ten thousand dancers performed in the courtyard.
translations.idiomatic: The ascending singers performed 'Deer Cry,' the descending pipers played 'New Palace,' the eight rows of dancers were all in order, and ten thousand performers danced in the courtyard.

sentences.zh: 朕固薄德，何以克當？

translations.literal: I indeed have meager virtue, how can I be worthy?
translations.idiomatic: I indeed possess meager virtue—how can I be worthy of this?

sentences.zh: 《易》陳負乘，《詩》刺彼己，永念慙疚，無忘厥心。

translations.literal: The Changes discusses carrying a burden, the Poetry criticizes self-interest, I perpetually contemplate shame and guilt, never forgetting this heart.
translations.idiomatic: The Book of Changes discusses bearing burdens, the Book of Poetry criticizes selfishness, I perpetually contemplate my shame and guilt, never forgetting this in my heart.

sentences.zh: 三老李躬，年耆學明。

translations.literal: The Three Elders Li Gong, aged and learned in the classics.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Elders Li Gong, advanced in years and learned in the classics.

sentences.zh: 五更桓榮，授朕《尚書》。

translations.literal: The Elder Huan Rong taught Me the Book of Documents.
translations.idiomatic: The Elder Huan Rong taught me the Book of Documents.

sentences.zh: 《詩》曰：「無德不報，無言不酬。」

translations.literal: The Poetry says: 'No virtue goes unrewarded, no words go unanswered.'
translations.idiomatic: As the Poetry says: 'No virtue goes unrewarded, no words go unanswered.'

sentences.zh: 其賜榮爵關內侯，食邑五千戶。

translations.literal: Therefore, grant Rong the title of Marquis within the Passes, with a fief of five thousand households.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, grant Huan Rong the title of Marquis within the Passes, with a fief of five thousand households.

sentences.zh: 三老、五更皆以二千石祿養終厥身。

translations.literal: The Three Elders and Five Seniors shall all be supported with two thousand shi salaries for the rest of their lives.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Elders and Five Seniors shall all be supported with salaries equivalent to two thousand shi officials for the rest of their lives.

sentences.zh: 其賜天下三老酒人一石，肉四十斤。

translations.literal: Therefore, grant to the Three Elders throughout the world each one shi of wine and forty jin of meat.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, grant to the Three Elders throughout the empire each one shi of wine and forty jin of meat.

sentences.zh: 有司其存耆耋，恤幼孤，惠鰥寡，稱朕意焉。』

translations.literal: Officials should care for the elderly, show compassion to orphans, extend benevolence to the widowed and solitary, and fulfill My intentions.'
translations.idiomatic: Officials should care for the elderly, show compassion to orphans, extend benevolence to the widowed and solitary, and fulfill My intentions.'

sentences.zh: 中山王焉始就國。

translations.literal: King Yan of Zhongshan for the first time took up residence in his fief.
translations.idiomatic: King Yan of Zhongshan for the first time took up residence in his fief.

sentences.zh: 甲子，西巡狩，幸長安，祠高廟，遂有事於十一陵。

translations.literal: Jiazi day: He conducted a western inspection tour, proceeded to Chang'an, sacrificed at the Gao Temple, and then performed ceremonies at the eleven imperial tombs.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day, he conducted a western imperial inspection tour, proceeded to Chang'an, performed sacrifices at the Gao Temple, and then conducted ceremonies at the eleven imperial tombs.

sentences.zh: 歷覽館邑，會郡縣吏，勞賜作樂。

translations.literal: He toured the lodges and towns, assembled the commandery and county officials, rewarded and encouraged them, and had music performed.
translations.idiomatic: He toured the lodges and towns, assembled the commandery and county officials, rewarded and encouraged them, and had music performed.

sentences.zh: 十一月甲申，遣使者以中牢祠蕭何、霍光。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Jiashen day: He dispatched envoys to sacrifice to Xiao He and Huo Guang with the middle sacrificial offering.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day of the eleventh month, he dispatched envoys to perform sacrifices to Xiao He and Huo Guang using the middle sacrificial offering.

sentences.zh: 帝謁陵園，過式其墓。

translations.literal: The Emperor paid respects at the tomb gardens, and when passing by, he performed the ritual at their graves.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor paid respects at the tomb gardens, and when passing by, he performed the ceremonial rites at their graves.

sentences.zh: 進幸河東，所過賜二千石、令長已下至於掾史，各有差。

translations.literal: He proceeded to Hedong; wherever he passed, he granted rewards to Two Thousand Bushel officials, county magistrates and below down to the clerks, each according to their rank.
translations.idiomatic: He proceeded to Hedong; wherever he passed, he granted rewards to Two Thousand Bushel officials, county magistrates and below down to the clerks, each according to their position.

sentences.zh: 癸卯，車駕還宮。

translations.literal: Guimao day: The imperial carriage returned to the palace.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day, the imperial carriage returned to the palace.

sentences.zh: 十二月，護羌校尉竇林下獄死。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Protector General of the Qiang Dou Lin was imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Protector General of the Qiang Dou Lin was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 是歲，始迎氣於五郊。

translations.literal: This year, they began welcoming the qi at the five suburbs.
translations.idiomatic: This year, they began the ceremonies to welcome the seasonal qi at the five suburbs.

sentences.zh: 少府陰就子豐殺其妻酈邑公主，就坐自殺。

translations.literal: Vice Director of the Imperial Household Yin Jiu's son Feng killed his wife Princess Liyi; Jiu was convicted and committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Vice Director of the Imperial Household Yin Jiu's son Feng murdered his wife Princess Liyi; Jiu was convicted and took his own life.

sentences.zh: 三年春正月癸巳，詔曰：『朕奉郊祀，登靈臺，見史官，正儀度。

translations.literal: Third year, spring, first month, Guisi day: He issued an edict saying: 'I conducted the suburban sacrifices, ascended the Spirit Tower, met with the historians, and corrected the rituals and measures.'
translations.idiomatic: On the Guisi day of the first month of spring in the third year, he issued an edict: 'I conducted the suburban sacrifices, ascended the Spirit Tower, met with the historians, and corrected the rituals and measures.'

sentences.zh: 夫春者，歲之始也。

translations.literal: 'Spring is the beginning of the year.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Spring is the beginning of the year.'

sentences.zh: 始得其正，則三時有成。

translations.literal: 'If we begin by getting it right, then the three seasons will be successful.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If we begin by getting it right, then the three seasons will be successful.'

sentences.zh: 比者水旱不節，邊人食寡，政失於上，人受其咎，有司其勉順時氣，勸督農桑，去其螟蜮，以及蝥賊；

translations.literal: 'Recently floods and droughts have been out of season, border people have scarce food, government policies have failed from above, people suffer the consequences; officials should diligently follow the seasonal qi, encourage and supervise farming and sericulture, eliminate the harmful insects and harmful ministers, as well as the parasitic bandits;'
translations.idiomatic: 'Recently floods and droughts have been out of season, border people have scarce food supplies, government policies have failed from above, and people suffer the consequences; officials should diligently follow the seasonal influences, encourage and supervise agriculture and sericulture, eliminate harmful insects and corrupt ministers, as well as parasitic bandits;'

sentences.zh: 詳刑慎罰，明察單辭，夙夜匪懈，以稱朕意。』

translations.literal: 'Be detailed in punishments and careful with penalties, clearly examine single statements, be diligent morning and night without relaxation, to fulfill My intentions.''
translations.idiomatic: 'Be detailed in applying punishments and careful with penalties, clearly examine even single statements, work diligently morning and night without relaxation, to fulfill My intentions.''

sentences.zh: 二月甲寅，太尉趙憙、司徒李訢免。

translations.literal: Second month, Jia Yin day: Grand Marshal Zhao Xi and Minister of the Masses Li Hong were dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiayin day of the second month, Grand Marshal Zhao Xi and Minister of the Masses Li Hong were dismissed from office.

sentences.zh: 丙辰，左馮翊郭丹為司徒。

translations.literal: Bingchen day: Left Commandant of the Capital Guo Dan became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day, Left Commandant of the Capital Guo Dan was appointed Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 己未，南陽太守虞延為太尉。

translations.literal: Jiwei day: Nanyang Grand Administrator Yu Yan became Grand Marshal.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiwei day, Nanyang Grand Administrator Yu Yan was appointed Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 甲子，立貴人馬氏為皇后，皇子炟為皇太子。

translations.literal: Jiazi day: He established the Honorable Lady Ma as Empress, and the imperial son Zhao as Crown Prince.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day, he established the Honorable Lady Ma as Empress and the imperial son Zhao as Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 賜天下男子爵，人二級；

translations.literal: He granted advancement in noble rank to all males throughout the realm, each by two levels;
translations.idiomatic: He granted advancement in noble rank to all males throughout the empire, each by two levels;

sentences.zh: 三老、孝悌、力田人三級；

translations.literal: Three Elders, filial and fraternal people, and diligent farmers each by three levels;
translations.idiomatic: Three Elders, filial and fraternal people, and diligent farmers shall each be advanced three levels;

sentences.zh: 流人無名數欲占者人一級；

translations.literal: Exiled people without registered numbers who wish to register themselves each by one level;
translations.idiomatic: Exiled people without registered numbers who wish to register themselves shall each be advanced one level;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃、貧不能自存者粟，人五斛。

translations.literal: The widowed, orphaned, solitary, severely disabled, and poor who cannot support themselves shall each receive five dou of grain.
translations.idiomatic: The widowed, orphaned, solitary, severely disabled, and poor who cannot support themselves shall each receive five dou of grain.

sentences.zh: 夏四月辛酉，封皇子建為千乘王，羨為廣平王。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Xin You day: He enfeoffed the imperial son Jian as King of Qiancheng, and Xian as King of Guangping.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day of the fourth month of summer, he enfeoffed the imperial son Jian as King of Qiancheng and Xian as King of Guangping.

sentences.zh: 六月丁卯，有星孛於天船北。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Ding Mao day: There was a broom star north of the Heavenly Ship.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day of the sixth month, a comet appeared north of the Heavenly Ship constellation.

sentences.zh: 秋八月戊辰，改大樂為大予樂。

translations.literal: Autumn, eighth month, Wu Chen day: He changed the name of the Grand Music to Grand Yu Music.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day of the eighth month of autumn, he changed the name of the Grand Music to Grand Yu Music.

sentences.zh: 壬申晦，日有蝕之。

translations.literal: Renshen day, new moon: There was a solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renshen day of the new moon, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『朕奉承祖業，無有善政。

translations.literal: He issued an edict saying: 'I inherit the ancestral enterprise, but have no good governance.'
translations.idiomatic: He issued an edict: 'I inherit the ancestral enterprise, but have implemented no good governance.'

sentences.zh: 日月薄蝕，彗孛見天，水旱不節，稼穡不成，人無宿儲，下生愁墊。

translations.literal: The sun and moon are eclipsed, comets appear in the sky, floods and droughts are out of season, the crops do not succeed, people have no stored provisions, the common people are born into distress and depression.'
translations.idiomatic: The sun and moon are eclipsed, comets appear in the heavens, floods and droughts are untimely, crops fail, people have no stored provisions, and the common people are born into hardship and misery.'

sentences.zh: 雖夙夜勤思，而智能不逮。

translations.literal: Though I diligently contemplate morning and night, my wisdom and ability do not suffice.'
translations.idiomatic: Though I diligently reflect morning and night, my wisdom and capabilities are inadequate.'

sentences.zh: 昔楚莊無災，以致戒懼；

translations.literal: Formerly, King Zhuang of Chu had no disasters, yet he remained vigilant and fearful;'
translations.idiomatic: In the past, King Zhuang of Chu experienced no disasters, yet he remained vigilant and fearful;'

sentences.zh: 魯哀禍大，天不降譴。

translations.literal: Duke Ai of Lu suffered great calamities, yet Heaven did not send down punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai of Lu suffered great misfortunes, yet Heaven did not send down condemnation.'

sentences.zh: 今之動變，儻尚可救。

translations.literal: Today's disturbances and changes can perhaps still be remedied.'
translations.idiomatic: The disturbances and changes of today can perhaps still be saved.'

sentences.zh: 有司勉思厥職，以匡無德。

translations.literal: Officials should earnestly contemplate their duties, to correct My lack of virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Officials should diligently reflect on their responsibilities, to remedy My lack of virtue.'

sentences.zh: 古者卿士獻詩，百工箴諫。

translations.literal: In ancient times, the ministers and nobles presented poems, the various officials offered remonstrances.'
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, ministers and nobles presented poems, and all officials offered admonitory advice.'

sentences.zh: 其言事者，靡有所諱。』

translations.literal: Those who memorialize on affairs should have no prohibitions.'
translations.idiomatic: Those who memorialize on matters of state should hold nothing back.'

sentences.zh: 冬十月，蒸祭光武廟，初奏《文始》、《五行》、《武德》之舞。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: He performed the zheng sacrifice at the Guangwu Temple, and for the first time performed the dances of 'Wen Shi', 'Wu Xing', and 'Wu De'.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, he performed the zheng sacrifice at the Guangwu Temple, and for the first time performed the dances of 'Wen Shi', 'Wu Xing', and 'Wu De'.

sentences.zh: 甲子，車駕從皇太后幸章陵，觀舊廬。

translations.literal: Jiazi day: The imperial carriage followed the Empress Dowager to Zhangling, where they viewed the old residence.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day, the imperial carriage followed the Empress Dowager to Zhangling, where they viewed the old residence.

sentences.zh: 十二月戊辰，至自章陵。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Wuchen day: He arrived back from Zhangling.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day of the twelfth month, he arrived back from Zhangling.

sentences.zh: 是歲，起北宮及諸官府。

translations.literal: This year, he built the Northern Palace and the various government offices.
translations.idiomatic: This year, construction began on the Northern Palace and the various government offices.

sentences.zh: 京師及郡國七大水。

translations.literal: The capital and seven commanderies and kingdoms suffered great floods.
translations.idiomatic: The capital and seven commanderies and kingdoms experienced major flooding.

sentences.zh: 四年春二月辛亥，詔曰：『朕親耕藉田，以祈農事。

translations.literal: Fourth year, spring, second month, Xinhai day: He issued an edict saying: 'I personally plow the ritual fields to pray for agricultural affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinhai day of the second month of spring in the fourth year, he issued an edict: 'I personally plow the ritual fields to pray for successful agriculture.'

sentences.zh: 京師冬無宿雪，春不燠沐，煩勞群司，積精禱求。

translations.literal: The capital in winter has no lasting snow, in spring has no warming baths; I have troubled all the officials, accumulating my energies in prayer and supplication.'
translations.idiomatic: The capital has had no lasting snow in winter, no warming baths in spring; I have troubled all the officials, concentrating my energies in prayer and supplication.'

sentences.zh: 而比再得時雨，宿麥潤澤。

translations.literal: Yet recently we have twice received timely rains, moistening the winter wheat.'
translations.idiomatic: Yet recently we have twice received timely rains, which have moistened the winter wheat.'

sentences.zh: 其賜公卿半奉。

translations.literal: Therefore, grant the dukes and ministers half their salaries.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, grant the dukes and ministers half their stipends.'

sentences.zh: 有司勉遵時政，務平刑罰。』

translations.literal: Officials should diligently follow seasonal governance, and strive for fairness in punishments.'
translations.idiomatic: Officials should earnestly comply with seasonal governance, and work to ensure equitable application of punishments.'

sentences.zh: 秋九月戊寅，千乘王建薨。

translations.literal: Autumn, ninth month, Wuyin day: King Jian of Qiancheng passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuyin day of the ninth month of autumn, King Jian of Qiancheng passed away.

sentences.zh: 冬十月乙卯，司徒郭丹、司空馮魴免。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Yi Mao day: Minister of the Masses Guo Dan and Minister of Works Feng Pang were dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yimao day of the tenth month of winter, Minister of the Masses Guo Dan and Minister of Works Feng Pang were dismissed from office.

sentences.zh: 丙辰，河南尹范遷為司徒，太僕伏恭為司空。

translations.literal: Bingchen day: Henan Governor Fan Qian became Minister of the Masses, Director of the Imperial Stud Fu Gong became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day, Henan Governor Fan Qian was appointed Minister of the Masses, and Director of the Imperial Stud Fu Gong was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 十二月，陵鄉侯梁松下獄死。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Marquis of Lingxiang Liang Song was imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Marquis of Lingxiang Liang Song was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 五年春二月庚戌，驃騎將軍東平王蒼罷歸藩；

translations.literal: Fifth year, spring, second month, Gengxu day: General of Agile Cavalry and King Cang of Dongping was dismissed and returned to his fief;
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengxu day of the second month of spring in the fifth year, General of Agile Cavalry and King Cang of Dongping was dismissed from office and returned to his fief;

sentences.zh: 琅邪王京就國。

translations.literal: King Jing of Langye took up residence in his fief.
translations.idiomatic: King Jing of Langye took up residence in his fief.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，行幸鄴。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: He proceeded to Ye.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, he proceeded to Ye.

sentences.zh: 與趙王栩會鄴。

translations.literal: He met with King Xu of Zhao at Ye.
translations.idiomatic: He met with King Xu of Zhao at Ye.

sentences.zh: 常山三老言於帝曰：『上生於元氏，願蒙優復。』

translations.literal: The Three Elders of Changshan spoke to the Emperor saying: 'Your Majesty was born in Yuanshi, we wish to receive preferential tax relief.'
translations.idiomatic: The Three Elders of Changshan spoke to the Emperor saying: 'Your Majesty was born in Yuanshi county, we wish to receive preferential tax exemptions.'

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『豐、沛、濟陽，受命所由，加恩報德，適其宜也。

translations.literal: He issued an edict saying: 'Feng, Pei, and Jiyang are the places from which the mandate was received, adding benevolence and repaying virtue is fitting.'
translations.idiomatic: He issued an edict: 'Feng, Pei, and Jiyang are the places from which the mandate originated, so adding benevolence and repaying virtue is entirely appropriate.'

sentences.zh: 今永平之政，百姓怨結，而吏人求復，令人愧笑。

translations.literal: Now the Yongping governance has caused the common people to harbor resentments, yet officials seek tax relief, which causes shame and ridicule.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the Yongping administration has caused the common people to harbor deep resentments, yet officials seek tax exemptions, which causes shame and derision.'

sentences.zh: 重逆此縣之拳拳，其復元氏縣田租更賦六歲，勞賜縣掾史，及門闌走卒。』

translations.literal: Going against the earnest devotion of this county would be grave; therefore, exempt Yuanshi county from land taxes and labor service for six years, and reward the county clerks and gatekeepers with gifts.''
translations.idiomatic: To go against the earnest devotion of this county would be most inappropriate; therefore, exempt Yuanshi county from land taxes and labor service for six years, and bestow rewards upon the county clerks and gatekeepers.''

sentences.zh: 至自鄴。

translations.literal: He arrived back from Ye.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived back from Ye.

sentences.zh: 十一月，北匈奴寇五原；

translations.literal: Eleventh month: The Northern Xiongnu raided Wuyuan;
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, the Northern Xiongnu raided Wuyuan;

sentences.zh: 十二月；

translations.literal: Twelfth month;
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month;

sentences.zh: 寇雲中，南單于擊卻之。

translations.literal: They raided Yunzhong, the Southern Chanyu attacked and repelled them.
translations.idiomatic: They raided Yunzhong, but the Southern Chanyu attacked and drove them back.

sentences.zh: 是歲，發遣邊人在內郡者，賜裝錢人二萬。

translations.literal: This year, he dispatched border people who were in the inner commanderies, granting each person twenty thousand cash for travel expenses.
translations.idiomatic: This year, he sent back border people who had been in the inner commanderies, granting each person twenty thousand cash for their journey.

sentences.zh: 六年春正月，沛王輔、楚王英、東平王蒼、淮陽王延、浪邪王京、東海王政、趙王盱、北海王興、齊王石來朝。

translations.literal: Sixth year, spring, first month: King Fu of Pei, King Ying of Chu, King Cang of Dongping, King Yan of Huaiyang, King Jing of Langye, King Zheng of Donghai, King Xu of Zhao, King Xing of Beihai, King Shi of Qi came to court.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the sixth year, Kings Fu of Pei, Ying of Chu, Cang of Dongping, Yan of Huaiyang, Jing of Langye, Zheng of Donghai, Xu of Zhao, Xing of Beihai, and Shi of Qi came to pay court to the emperor.

sentences.zh: 二月，王雒山出寶鼎，廬江太守獻之。

translations.literal: Second month: A precious tripod emerged from Wangluo Mountain, the Lujiang Grand Administrator presented it.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, a precious tripod emerged from Wangluo Mountain, and the Lujiang Grand Administrator presented it to the emperor.

sentences.zh: 夏四月甲子，詔曰：『昔禹收九牧之金，鑄鼎以象物，使人知神姦，不逢惡氣。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Jiazi day: He issued an edict saying: 'In ancient times Yu collected gold from the nine provinces, cast tripods to symbolize things, so that people could know divine wickedness and avoid evil qi.'
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day of the fourth month of summer, he issued an edict: 'In ancient times, Yu collected gold from the nine provinces and cast tripods to symbolize all things, so that people could recognize divine wickedness and avoid evil influences.'

sentences.zh: 遭德則興，遷於商、周；

translations.literal: When virtue is encountered they flourish, they were transferred to the Shang and Zhou;
translations.idiomatic: When they encountered virtue they flourished, and were passed down to the Shang and Zhou dynasties;

sentences.zh: 周德既衰，鼎乃淪亡。

translations.literal: When Zhou virtue declined, the tripods were lost and perished.'
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou virtue declined, the tripods sank into oblivion and were lost.'

sentences.zh: 祥瑞之降，以應有德。

translations.literal: Auspicious omens descend to respond to those with virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Auspicious omens descend in response to those who possess virtue.'

sentences.zh: 方今政化多僻，何以致茲？

translations.literal: Now governance and transformation are largely deviant, how have we arrived at this?'
translations.idiomatic: Nowadays, political transformation is largely corrupt—how have we come to this?'

sentences.zh: 《易》曰鼎象三公，豈公卿奉職得其理邪？

translations.literal: The Changes says the tripod symbolizes the Three Dukes, could it be that the dukes and ministers performing their duties have attained proper reason?'
translations.idiomatic: The Book of Changes says the tripod symbolizes the Three Dukes—could it be that the dukes and ministers in performing their duties have achieved proper order?'

sentences.zh: 太常其以礿祭之日，陳鼎於廟，以備器用。

translations.literal: Let the Grand Herald on the day of the seasonal sacrifice display the tripod in the temple to prepare the ritual vessels.'
translations.idiomatic: Let the Grand Herald display the tripod in the temple on the day of the seasonal sacrifice to prepare the ritual implements.'

sentences.zh: 賜三公帛五十匹，九卿、二千石半之。

translations.literal: Grant the Three Dukes fifty bolts of silk each, the Nine Ministers and Two Thousand Bushel officials half that.'
translations.idiomatic: Grant fifty bolts of silk each to the Three Dukes, and half that amount to the Nine Ministers and Two Thousand Bushel officials.'

sentences.zh: 先帝詔書，禁人上事言聖，而間者章奏頗多浮詞，自今若有過稱虛譽，尚書皆宜抑而不省，示不為諂子蚩也。』

translations.literal: The late Emperor's edict prohibited people from using the character 'sage' in memorializing affairs, yet recently memorials have contained many exaggerated phrases; from now on, if there are excessive praises and empty reputations, the Chamberlain for Attendants should suppress them and not examine them, showing that we do not act for sycophants and fools.''
translations.idiomatic: The late Emperor's edict forbade people from using the word 'sage' in their memorials, yet recently many memorials have contained exaggerated language; from now on, if there are excessive praises and false reputations, the Chamberlain for Attendants should suppress them without review, showing that we do not cater to flatterers and fools.''

sentences.zh: 冬十月，行幸魯，祠東海恭王陵；

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: He proceeded to Lu, performed sacrifices at the tomb of King Gong of Donghai;
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, he proceeded to Lu and performed sacrifices at the tomb of King Gong of Donghai;

sentences.zh: 會沛王輔、楚王英、濟南王康、東平王蒼、淮陽王延、琅邪王京、東海王政。

translations.literal: He met with King Fu of Pei, King Ying of Chu, King Kang of Jinan, King Cang of Dongping, King Yan of Huaiyang, King Jing of Langye, King Zheng of Donghai.
translations.idiomatic: He met with Kings Fu of Pei, Ying of Chu, Kang of Jinan, Cang of Dongping, Yan of Huaiyang, Jing of Langye, and Zheng of Donghai.

sentences.zh: 十二月，還，幸陽城，遣使者祠中嶽。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: He returned, proceeded to Yangcheng, dispatched envoys to sacrifice at the Central Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, he returned and proceeded to Yangcheng, dispatching envoys to perform sacrifices at the Central Peak.

sentences.zh: 壬午，車駕還宮。

translations.literal: Renwu day: The imperial carriage returned to the palace.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renwu day, the imperial carriage returned to the palace.

sentences.zh: 東平王蒼、琅邪王京從駕來朝皇太后。

translations.literal: King Cang of Dongping and King Jing of Langye followed the imperial carriage to pay court to the Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: Kings Cang of Dongping and Jing of Langye followed the imperial carriage to pay respects to the Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 七年春正月癸卯，皇太后陰氏崩。

translations.literal: Seventh year, spring, first month, Gui Mao day: Empress Dowager Yin passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day of the first month of spring in the seventh year, Empress Dowager Yin passed away.

sentences.zh: 二月庚申，葬光烈皇后。

translations.literal: Second month, Gengshen day: He buried Empress Guanglie.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengshen day of the second month, he buried Empress Guanglie.

sentences.zh: 秋八月戊辰，北海王興薨。

translations.literal: Autumn, eighth month, Wuchen day: King Xing of Beihai passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day of the eighth month of autumn, King Xing of Beihai passed away.

sentences.zh: 是歲，北匈奴遣使乞和親。

translations.literal: This year, the Northern Xiongnu dispatched envoys to request peaceful marriage alliance.
translations.idiomatic: This year, the Northern Xiongnu sent envoys requesting a peaceful marriage alliance.

sentences.zh: 遣越騎司馬鄭眾報使北匈奴。

translations.literal: He dispatched Cavalry Commandant Zheng Zhong to respond to the Northern Xiongnu envoys.
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched Cavalry Commandant Zheng Zhong to reply to the Northern Xiongnu envoys.

sentences.zh: 初置度遼將軍，屯五原曼柏。

translations.literal: For the first time he established the General of Liaodong, garrisoning at Manbai in Wuyuan.
translations.idiomatic: For the first time, he established the office of General of Liaodong, with troops garrisoned at Manbai in Wuyuan.

sentences.zh: 秋，郡國十四雨水。

translations.literal: Autumn: Fourteen commanderies and kingdoms suffered flooding.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, fourteen commanderies and kingdoms experienced flooding.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，北宮成。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: The Northern Palace was completed.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, the Northern Palace was completed.

sentences.zh: 丙子，臨辟雍，養三老、五更。

translations.literal: Bingzi day: He attended the Biyong and honored the Three Elders and Five Seniors.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingzi day, he attended the Biyong Academy and honored the Three Elders and Five Seniors.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，詔三公募郡國中都官死罪繫囚，減罪一等，勿笞，詣度遼將軍營，屯朔方、五原之邊縣；

translations.literal: After the ceremonies were completed, he decreed that the Three Dukes should recruit from the commanderies and kingdoms the death-row prisoners held in the capital offices, reduce their sentences by one degree, exempt them from beating, and send them to the General of Liaodong's camp to garrison the border counties of Shuofang and Wuyuan;
translations.idiomatic: After the rites were completed, he ordered the Three Dukes to recruit death-row prisoners held in the capital offices from the commanderies and kingdoms, reduce their sentences by one degree, exempt them from corporal punishment, and send them to the General of Liaodong's encampment to garrison the border counties of Shuofang and Wuyuan;

sentences.zh: 妻子自隨，便占著邊縣；

translations.literal: Their wives and children may accompany them, and they may conveniently register as residents of the border counties;
translations.idiomatic: Their wives and children may accompany them, and they may conveniently register as residents of the border counties;

sentences.zh: 父母同產欲相代者，恣聽之。

translations.literal: Those whose parents or siblings wish to take their place, allow them to do so freely.'
translations.idiomatic: Those whose parents or siblings wish to substitute for them, permit them to do so at will.'

sentences.zh: 其大逆無道殊死者，一切募下蠶室。

translations.literal: Those guilty of great treachery and wickedness punishable by death by dismemberment, all recruit them to serve in the silkworm chamber.'
translations.idiomatic: Those guilty of great treachery and wickedness deserving death by dismemberment shall all be recruited to serve in the silkworm chamber.'

sentences.zh: 亡命者令贖罪各有差。

translations.literal: Fugitives shall be allowed to redeem their crimes according to the appropriate scale.'
translations.idiomatic: Fugitives shall be permitted to redeem their crimes on a graduated scale.'

sentences.zh: 凡徙者，賜弓弩衣粮。

translations.literal: All those who are relocated shall be granted bows, crossbows, clothing, and provisions.'
translations.idiomatic: All those who are transferred shall be provided with bows, crossbows, clothing, and rations.'

sentences.zh: 壬寅晦，日有食之，既。

translations.literal: Ren Yin day, new moon: There was a solar eclipse, and it was total.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renyin day of the new moon, there was a solar eclipse, and it was total.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『朕以無德，奉承大業，而下貽人怨，上動三光。

translations.literal: He issued an edict saying: 'I, lacking virtue, inherit the great enterprise, yet below I leave the people with resentment, above I disturb the three luminaries.
translations.idiomatic: He issued an edict: 'Though I lack virtue, I inherit the great enterprise, yet below I leave the people resentful, above I disturb the three luminaries.'

sentences.zh: 日食之變，其災尤大，《春秋》圖讖所為至譴。

translations.literal: The anomaly of the solar eclipse, its calamity is especially great, the Spring and Autumn Annals and prophetic texts consider it the greatest admonition.
translations.idiomatic: The anomaly of the solar eclipse is especially calamitous, the Spring and Autumn Annals and prophetic texts regard it as the most severe admonition.'

sentences.zh: 永思厥咎，在予一人。

translations.literal: I perpetually contemplate the guilt, it lies with me alone.
translations.idiomatic: I constantly reflect on the guilt, it rests with me alone.'

sentences.zh: 群司勉修職事，極言無諱。』

translations.literal: All officials should diligently perform their duties, speak with utmost frankness without prohibition.''
translations.idiomatic: All officials should earnestly fulfill their responsibilities, speak with complete candor without restraint.''

sentences.zh: 於是在位者皆上封事，各言得失。

translations.literal: Thereupon all officials in office submitted sealed memorials, each speaking of successes and failures.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon all officials in office submitted sealed memorials, each discussing the successes and failures.

sentences.zh: 帝覽章，深自引咎，乃以所上班示百官。

translations.literal: The Emperor read the memorials, deeply blamed himself, and then showed the submitted memorials to all the officials.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor reviewed the memorials, deeply reproached himself, and then showed the submitted memorials to all the officials.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『群僚所言，皆朕之過。

translations.literal: He issued an edict saying: 'What the assembled officials have said, all are My errors.
translations.idiomatic: He issued an edict: 'What the assembled officials have spoken of, all are My faults.'

sentences.zh: 人冤不能理，吏黠不能禁；

translations.literal: People's grievances cannot be redressed, cunning officials cannot be restrained;
translations.idiomatic: People's injustices cannot be addressed, corrupt officials cannot be controlled;'

sentences.zh: 而輕用人力，繕修宮宇，出入無節，喜怒過差。

translations.literal: Yet I lightly employ manpower, repair and build palaces, go out and come in without measure, joy and anger exceed propriety.'
translations.idiomatic: Yet I frivolously employ manpower, repair and construct palaces, go out and come in without restraint, joy and anger exceed appropriate bounds.'

sentences.zh: 昔應門失守，《關雎》刺世；

translations.literal: Formerly the gates were not guarded, the Guan Ju criticizes the age;
translations.idiomatic: In the past when the gates were unguarded, the Guan Ju criticized the age;'

sentences.zh: 飛蓬隨風，微子所嘆。

translations.literal: Flying tumbleweed follows the wind, what Viscount Ji lamented.'
translations.idiomatic: Flying tumbleweed follows the wind, as Viscount Ji lamented.'

sentences.zh: 永覽前戒，竦然兢懼。

translations.literal: I perpetually contemplate the previous admonitions, standing in awe and fear.'
translations.idiomatic: I constantly reflect on the previous warnings, filled with awe and trepidation.'

sentences.zh: 徒恐薄德，久而致怠耳。』

translations.literal: I only fear that meager virtue, prolonged, will lead to indolence.''
translations.idiomatic: I only fear that meager virtue, when prolonged, will lead to negligence.''

sentences.zh: 北匈奴寇西河諸郡。

translations.literal: The Northern Xiongnu raided the various commanderies of Xihe.
translations.idiomatic: The Northern Xiongnu raided the various commanderies of Xihe.

sentences.zh: 九年春三月辛丑，詔郡國死罪囚減罪，與妻子詣五原、朔方占著，所在死者皆賜妻父若男同產一人復終身；

translations.literal: Ninth year, spring, third month, Xinchou day: He decreed that commandery and kingdom death-row prisoners should have their sentences reduced, and with their wives and children go to Wuyuan and Shuofang to register as residents; for those who die at their location, grant lifelong tax exemption to one person—the wife's father or the husband's younger brother;
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinchou day of the third month of spring in the ninth year, he decreed that death-row prisoners from the commanderies and kingdoms should have their sentences reduced, and with their wives and children go to Wuyuan and Shuofang to register as residents; for those who die at their assigned location, grant lifelong tax exemption to one person—the wife's father or the husband's younger brother;

sentences.zh: 其妻無父兄獨有母者，賜其母錢六萬，又復其口筭。

translations.literal: For those whose wives have no father or brothers but only a mother, grant her mother sixty thousand cash, and also exempt her from the poll tax.'
translations.idiomatic: For those whose wives have no father or brothers but only a mother, grant her mother sixty thousand cash, and also exempt her from the poll tax.'

sentences.zh: 夏四月甲辰，詔郡國以公田賜貧人各有差。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Jiachen day: He decreed that commanderies and kingdoms should grant public fields to poor people according to their circumstances.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiachen day of the fourth month of summer, he decreed that commanderies and kingdoms should grant public fields to poor people according to their individual circumstances.

sentences.zh: 令司隸校尉、部刺史歲上墨綬長吏視事三歲已上理狀尤異者各一人，與計偕上。

translations.literal: He ordered the Commandant of the Capital Region and the provincial Governors to annually submit one black-sashed senior official each who had served three years or more and whose administrative record was especially outstanding, to be submitted along with the accounts.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the Commandant of the Capital Region and the provincial Governors to annually submit one black-sashed senior official each who had served three years or more and whose administrative performance was exceptionally outstanding, to be submitted together with their annual accounts.

sentences.zh: 及尤不政理者，亦以聞。

translations.literal: And those who are especially poor at governance should also be reported.'
translations.idiomatic: And those who are particularly ineffective at administration should also be reported.'

sentences.zh: 是歲，大有年。

translations.literal: This year, there was a great harvest.
translations.idiomatic: This year, there was an abundant harvest.

sentences.zh: 為四姓小侯開立學校，置《五經》師。

translations.literal: He established schools for the minor marquises of the four surnames, and appointed teachers for the Five Classics.
translations.idiomatic: He established schools for the minor marquises of the four surnames and appointed teachers for the Five Classics.

sentences.zh: 十年春二月，廣陵王荊有罪，自殺，國除。

translations.literal: Tenth year, spring, second month: King Jing of Guangling committed a crime, committed suicide, his fief was abolished.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of spring of the tenth year, King Jing of Guangling committed a crime, took his own life, and his fief was abolished.

sentences.zh: 夏四月戊子，詔曰：『昔歲五谷登衍，今茲蠶麥善收，其大赦天下。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Wuzi day: He issued an edict saying: 'In previous years the five grains were abundant, this year the silkworms and wheat have good yields, therefore grant a great amnesty to the world.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuzi day of the fourth month of summer, he issued an edict: 'In previous years the five grains were abundant, this year the silkworms and wheat have had good harvests, therefore grant a great amnesty throughout the realm.'

sentences.zh: 方盛夏長養之時，蕩滌宿惡，以報農功。

translations.literal: It is now the season of intense summer when growth flourishes, cleanse away old evils, to repay the merit of farming.'
translations.idiomatic: It is now the season of flourishing summer when growth is abundant, cleanse away accumulated evils, to repay the merit of agriculture.'

sentences.zh: 百姓勉務桑稼，以備災害。

translations.literal: The common people should diligently apply themselves to sericulture and agriculture, to prepare for disasters.'
translations.idiomatic: The common people should earnestly devote themselves to mulberry cultivation and farming, to prepare for calamities.'

sentences.zh: 吏敬厥職，無令愆墮。

translations.literal: Officials should respect their duties, do not allow them to err or fail.'
translations.idiomatic: Officials should respect their responsibilities, do not allow them to make mistakes or neglect their duties.'

sentences.zh: 閏月甲午，南巡狩，幸南陽，祠章陵。

translations.literal: Intercalary month, Jiawu day: He conducted a southern inspection tour, proceeded to Nanyang, performed sacrifices at Zhangling.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiawu day of the intercalary month, he conducted a southern imperial inspection tour, proceeded to Nanyang, and performed sacrifices at Zhangling.

sentences.zh: 日北至，又祠舊宅。

translations.literal: When the sun reached its northernmost point, he also performed sacrifices at the old residence.
translations.idiomatic: When the sun reached its northernmost point, he also performed sacrifices at the old residence.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，召校官弟子作雅樂，奏《鹿鳴》，帝自御塤篪和之，以娛嘉賓。

translations.literal: After the ceremonies were completed, he summoned the academy officials and students to perform refined music, playing 'Deer Cry', the Emperor personally played the xun and chi to accompany them, to entertain the honored guests.
translations.idiomatic: After the rites were completed, he summoned the academy officials and students to perform elegant music, playing 'Deer Cry', and the Emperor personally played the xun and chi to accompany them, to entertain the honored guests.

sentences.zh: 還，幸南頓，勞饗三老、官屬。

translations.literal: He returned, proceeded to Nandun, rewarded and feasted the Three Elders and officials.
translations.idiomatic: He returned and proceeded to Nandun, where he rewarded and feasted the Three Elders and local officials.

sentences.zh: 冬十一月，徵淮陽王延會平輿，徵沛王輔會睢陽。

translations.literal: Winter, eleventh month: He summoned King Yan of Huaiyang to meet at Pingyu, summoned King Fu of Pei to meet at Suiyang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month of winter, he summoned King Yan of Huaiyang to meet at Pingyu and summoned King Fu of Pei to meet at Suiyang.

sentences.zh: 十二月甲午，車駕還宮。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Jiawu day: The imperial carriage returned to the palace.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiawu day of the twelfth month, the imperial carriage returned to the palace.

sentences.zh: 十一年春正月，沛王輔、楚王英、濟南王康、東平王蒼、淮陽王延、中山王焉、琅邪王京、東海王政來朝。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, spring, first month: King Fu of Pei, King Ying of Chu, King Kang of Jinan, King Cang of Dongping, King Yan of Huaiyang, King Yan of Zhongshan, King Jing of Langye, King Zheng of Donghai came to court.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the eleventh year, Kings Fu of Pei, Ying of Chu, Kang of Jinan, Cang of Dongping, Yan of Huaiyang, Yan of Zhongshan, Jing of Langye, and Zheng of Donghai came to pay court to the emperor.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，司隸校尉郭霸下獄死。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: Commandant of the Capital Region Guo Ba was imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, Commandant of the Capital Region Guo Ba was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 是歲，漅湖出黃金，廬江太守以獻。

translations.literal: This year, gold emerged from Zhaohu Lake, the Lujiang Grand Administrator presented it.
translations.idiomatic: This year, gold emerged from Zhaohu Lake, and the Lujiang Grand Administrator presented it to the emperor.

sentences.zh: 時，麒麟、白雉、醴泉、嘉禾所在出焉。

translations.literal: At this time, qilins, white pheasants, sweet springs, and excellent grain appeared in various places.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, qilins, white pheasants, sweet springs, and excellent grain appeared in various locations throughout the realm.

sentences.zh: 十二年春正月，益州徼外夷哀牢王相率內屬，於是置永昌郡，罷益州西部都尉。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, spring, first month: The Ailao kings of the barbarians beyond the borders of Yizhou led each other to submit inwardly, therefore Yongchang commandery was established, and the Western Area Commandant of Yizhou was abolished.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the twelfth year, the Ailao kings of the barbarian tribes beyond Yizhou's borders led each other to submit to Chinese rule, so Yongchang commandery was established and the Western Area Commandant of Yizhou was abolished.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，遣將作謁者王吳修汴渠，自滎陽至於千乘海口。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: He dispatched Court Gentleman of the Directorate of Construction Wang Wu to repair the Bian Canal, from Xingyang to the Qiancheng seaport.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, he dispatched Court Gentleman of the Directorate of Construction Wang Wu to repair the Bian Canal, from Xingyang all the way to the Qiancheng seaport.

sentences.zh: 五月丙辰，賜天下男子爵，人二級，三老、孝悌、力田人三級，流民無名數欲占者人一級；

translations.literal: Fifth month, Bingchen day: He granted advancement in noble rank to all males throughout the realm, each by two levels; Three Elders, filial and fraternal people, and diligent farmers each by three levels; exiled people without registered numbers who wish to register themselves each by one level;
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day of the fifth month, he granted advancement in noble rank to all males throughout the empire, each by two levels; Three Elders, filial and fraternal people, and diligent farmers each by three levels; exiled people without registered numbers who wish to register themselves each by one level;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃、貧無家屬不能自存者粟，人三斛。

translations.literal: The widowed, orphaned, solitary, severely disabled, and poor who have no family and cannot support themselves shall each receive three dou of grain.
translations.idiomatic: The widowed, orphaned, solitary, severely disabled, and poor who have no family members and cannot support themselves shall each receive three dou of grain.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『昔曾、閔奉親，竭歡致養；

translations.literal: He issued an edict saying: 'In former times Zeng and Min served their parents, exhausting their joy to provide nourishment;'
translations.idiomatic: He issued an edict: 'In former times, Zeng Shen and Min Ziqian served their parents, exhausting their happiness to provide for them;'

sentences.zh: 仲尼葬子，有棺無椁。

translations.literal: Zhongni buried his son with coffin but no outer coffin.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius buried his son with a coffin but no outer coffin.'

sentences.zh: 喪貴致哀，禮存寧儉。

translations.literal: Mourning values expressing grief, ritual preserves peace and frugality.'
translations.idiomatic: Mourning values expressing sorrow, ritual preserves tranquility and frugality.'

sentences.zh: 今百姓送終之制，競為奢靡。

translations.literal: Now the common people's system for sending off the deceased competes in extravagance.'
translations.idiomatic: Nowadays, the common people's funeral customs compete in extravagance.'

sentences.zh: 生者無擔石之儲，而財力盡於墳土。

translations.literal: The living have no storage of dan or shi, yet their wealth and strength are exhausted on tombs.'
translations.idiomatic: The living have no reserves of grain or wealth, yet their resources are exhausted on burial mounds.'

sentences.zh: 伏臘無糟糠，而牲牢兼於一奠。

translations.literal: During the Fu and La sacrifices there are no dregs or husks, yet sacrificial animals are combined in a single offering.'
translations.idiomatic: During the winter and year-end sacrifices there are no humble offerings, yet sacrificial animals are combined in a single ceremony.'

sentences.zh: 糜破積世之業，以供終朝之費，子孫饑寒，絕命於此，豈祖考之意哉！

translations.literal: They squander the accumulated wealth of generations to supply the expenses of a single morning, descendants go hungry and cold, meet their end in this way—could this be the intention of the ancestors?'
translations.idiomatic: They squander the accumulated wealth of generations to supply the expenses of a single funeral, descendants suffer hunger and cold, meet their end in this manner—could this possibly be the intention of our ancestors?'

sentences.zh: 又車服制度，恣極耳目。

translations.literal: Moreover, the regulations for carriages and robes indulge to the extreme for the eyes and ears.'
translations.idiomatic: Furthermore, the regulations for carriages and clothing indulge the eyes and ears to the extreme.'

sentences.zh: 田荒不耕，遊食者眾。

translations.literal: Fields lie fallow and uncultivated, those who eat without working are many.'
translations.idiomatic: Fields lie waste and untilled, while those who live off others without working are numerous.'

sentences.zh: 有司其申明科禁，宜於今者，宣下郡國。』

translations.literal: Officials should make clear the statutes and prohibitions that are appropriate for the present time, and proclaim them to the commanderies and kingdoms.''
translations.idiomatic: Officials should clarify the laws and prohibitions that are suitable for the current era, and proclaim them throughout the commanderies and kingdoms.''

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙亥，司空伏恭罷。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Yihai day: Minister of Works Fu Gong was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yihai day of the seventh month of autumn, Minister of Works Fu Gong was dismissed from office.

sentences.zh: 乙未，大司農牟融為司空。

translations.literal: Yiwei day: Grand Minister of Agriculture Mou Rong became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiwei day, Grand Minister of Agriculture Mou Rong was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，司隸校尉王康下獄死。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Commandant of the Capital Region Wang Kang was imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, Commandant of the Capital Region Wang Kang was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 是歲，天下安平，人無徭役，歲比登稔，百姓殷富，粟斛三十，牛羊被野。

translations.literal: This year, the world was peaceful and stable, people had no corvee labor, successive years brought abundant harvests, the common people were prosperous and wealthy, grain was thirty cash per dou, oxen and sheep covered the fields.
translations.idiomatic: This year, the realm was peaceful and tranquil, people were free from corvee labor, successive years brought bumper harvests, the common people were prosperous and wealthy, grain cost thirty cash per dou, and oxen and sheep filled the fields.

sentences.zh: 十三年春二月，帝耕於藉田。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, spring, second month: The Emperor plowed at the ritual fields.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of spring of the thirteenth year, the Emperor performed the ceremonial plowing at the ritual fields.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，賜觀者食。

translations.literal: When the ceremony was completed, he granted food to the observers.
translations.idiomatic: After the ceremony concluded, he bestowed food upon the spectators.

sentences.zh: 三月，河南尹薛昭下獄死。

translations.literal: Third month: Governor of Henan Xue Zhao was imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, Governor of Henan Xue Zhao was imprisoned and died.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，汴渠成。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: The Bian Canal was completed.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, the Bian Canal was completed.

sentences.zh: 辛巳，行幸滎陽，巡行河渠。

translations.literal: Xinsi day: He made a progress to Xingyang, inspected the rivers and canals.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinsi day, he made a journey to Xingyang and inspected the rivers and canals.

sentences.zh: 乙酉，詔曰：『自汴渠決敗，六十餘歲，加頃年以來，雨水不時，汴流東侵，日月益甚，水門故處，皆在河中，漭瀁廣溢，莫測圻岸，蕩蕩極望，不知綱紀。

translations.literal: Yiyou day: Imperial edict said: 'Since the Bian Canal broke and failed, it has been more than sixty years, moreover in recent years the rains and waters have been untimely, the Bian flow invades eastward, increasing day by day, the original locations of the water gates are all in the middle of the river, vast and overflowing, the riverbanks cannot be measured, gazing far into the vast expanse, there is no order or boundary.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day, an imperial edict stated: 'Since the Bian Canal broke and collapsed over sixty years ago, and moreover in recent years the rains and floods have been untimely, the Bian River has been encroaching eastward, worsening day by day, the original sites of the sluice gates are now all submerged in the river, with vast waters overflowing widely, making it impossible to discern the banks, and gazing out at the boundless expanse, there is no discernible order or limits.'

sentences.zh: 今兗、豫之人，多被水患，乃雲縣官不先人急，好興它役。
